p: According to the number of published articles, it might be concluded that Mentha species have been thoroughly investigated from their morphology and chemistry to a wide array of biological activities, and uses in different aspects of the food and pharmaceutical industries. Still, this genus is in the focus of scientists all over the world. Figure 1 shows a literature survey from the last twenty years on the Mentha species used in this study, i.e., the numbers of papers published referring to each particular species. Interestingly, the highest number of papers published for each mint, except for Mentha microphylla, was in 2020, which clearly shows that plants of this genus are being spotlighted among other medicinal and aromatic plants. Though the Americas and Asia are the biggest producers and consumers of mints, approximately one-third of studies have been European ( Figure 1), with Italy and Spain as the leading countries.
